description:
Go to this URL to read the instructions and get started with your team's Restaurant web app! 

https://github.com/helio-training/restaurants-app

When your team is done, submit the URL of the remote repository that shows your awesome code!

Note: Don't stress out over this!  We are just doing this exercise to help us figure out where we might need more practice and where any "mind bugs" or conceptual misunderstandings exist.  It is a "capacity test" and your capacity will be increased just by diving in to attempt this challenge.
name: Restaurants Code Jam!

rubric.description: App provides at least a master and detail view of restaurants
App provides a create and update Restaurants UI and functionality
App provides a read and delete Restaurants UI and functionality
App provides a view of a user's favorite restaurants
App provides a view of all the top rated restaurants
App uses the MEAN stack to provide this functionality
Bonus: Implement any UI framework to provide better look and feel
Bonus: Deploy the app to some hosting service or site.
Bonus: Implement some unit or end-to-end testing in your app
App is a good mix of design and functionality
Bonus: Implement observables in the HTTP service as per the tutorial

description:
Arrays have a lot of built in functions to ease development.  Occasionally building applications, you'll need some additional array functionality.

For this assignment you are tasked to build out some helper/utility function to help assist with manipulating or filtering arrays. There are some libraries that help easy development like LoDash.  If you get stuck with a particular problem use LoDash for inspiration.

Submit a CodePen or similar tool demonstrating competency.  Use this gist for data and sample submission.  Provide a proof to ensure that your utility works.

Make use of existing array functionality: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array

 

Utilities

Name Description Example
Combine Combine multiple arrays into one array. combine(["foo"], ["bar", "baz"], [1, 2]) => ["foo", "bar", "baz", 1, 2]
Compact Returns a copy of the array with all falsy values removed. compact([0, 1, false, 2, "", 3]) => [1, 2, 3]
Contains Returns true if the value is present in the array. contains([1, 2, 3], 3)  => true
Head/First Returns the first element of an array. head(["foo", "bar"]) => "foo"
Last Returns the last element of an array. last(["foo", "bar"]) => "bar"
Intersection Computes the list of values that are the intersection of all the arrays. Each value in the result is present in each of the arrays. intersection([1, 2, 3], [101, 2, 1, 10], [2, 1]) => [1, 2]
Unique Produces a duplicate-free version of the array. unique([1, 2, 1, 3, 1, 4]) => [1, 2, 3, 4]
Without Returns a copy of the array with all instances of the values removed. without([1, 2, 1, 0, 3, 1, 4], 0, 1) => [2, 3, 4]
Tail Returns everything but the first entry of the array. tail(["foo", "bar", "baz"]) => ["bar", "baz"]
Union Computes the union of the passed-in arrays: the list of unique items, in order, that are present in one or more of the arrays. union([1, 2, 3], [101, 2, 1, 10], [2, 1]) => [1, 2, 3, 101, 10]
Min Returns the minimum value in the array. min([10, 50, 30]) => 10
Max Returns the maximum value in the array. max([10, 50, 30]) => 50
Sum Returns the sum of all values in the array. sum([1, 2, 3]) => 6
Product Returns the product of all values in the array. product([2, 5, 10]) // => 100
name: Javascript Array Utilities

description:
Teams consist of 3 people.

As as group, decide on a project that can be completed in 3-4 weeks.  The application should utilize HTML, CSS, JS technologies. 

Deliverables

  1. Project Summary - Brief description of the project (Submitted here)
  2. GitHub repository url of the project with team members, and TylerGarlick (tjgarlick@gmail.com) as contributors (Repository url should be submitted here)
  3. Provide a plan with 3 deliverables (each following Wednesday).  Remember, everything in class is negotiable--this gives you flexibility as scope increases or decreases.  The plan should include a division of work. (Plan should be submitted here or as a url if you'd like to use github for the plan)
name: Team Project Deliverables

description:
Present your plan to the class and demonstrate deliverables.

Individually answer the following questions as retrospective about the team and the current deliverable

  • What did we do well?
  • What didn't go well?
  • What should we start doing?
  • What should we continue to do?
  • What should we stop doing?
name: Team Deliverable

description:

description:
Navigate to the github repository and follow the instructions on the readme.md.  

Submitting the assignment will require a url to your forked repository with the completed code.  Completion of the assignment will require that all the tests pass.  Additional testing is suggested by not required.
name: Country Utilities

description:
JSON is a way to describe information between systems.  Read about it here. 

For this assignment you'll create a few JSON objects. Submit the objects/arrays by putting two empty lines between your JSON submissions.  Submit your objects in the assignment's text input when your finished.  

Step 1: Create a Book JSON object for this book with the following information

  • Title
  • Author
  • Description
  • Price
  • ISBN13
  • ISBN10
  • Number of Pages
  • Publisher
  • Language

Step 2: Create a Order JSON object that holds all the information in this example order.

Step 3: Create an array of books from the book you created above and this information.  (You should have 3 JSON documents)

 

Hints

  • Remember JSON surrounds it's attributes with "" ("name": "tyler").  Values don't necessarily have "quotes"
  • JSON starts only with an { } (object), or an [ ] (array)
  • Remember the casing of the JSON (camel cased, or like this example 'firstName')
name: JSON Objects

description: Fork this repository, and follow the directions.  Upon completion, do a pull request into main repository.  Paste the pull request url in the website's url submission area.
name: Restaurant's API

description:
Command line primer for beginners on Unix/Max using Bash: http://lifehacker.com/5633909/who-needs-a-mouse-learn-to-use-the-command-line-for-almost-anything

How to install the bash shell on Windows 10: http://www.windowscentral.com/how-install-bash-shell-command-line-windows-10

 To get credit for this competency, demonstrate your ability to navigate, create, and execute shell scripts using the terminal or command line to an instructor or course mentor.
name: Use basic Bash/Terminal commands

rubric.long_description:
Learner is able to use Bash commands to:

  1. list all files in a directory including hidden files
  2. navigate up and down a directory structure
  3. redirect and pipe output between processes
  4. execute scripts from the terminal
  5. determine their network interfaces and IP address
  6. identify and edit environment and profile (e.g. .bash_profile) settings
  7. install software packages
  8. write and execute a custom script

description:
Post your thoughts on the following questions:

  1. What is an array?
  2. What are arrays good for?
  3. What does an empty array look like?
  4. Are there other types of arrays in JavaScript2015?

    2. How are they the same?
name: Arrays with Simple Types
